results.title: Disney Masterclass with Roy Conli and Glen Keane
results.brief_description:
Disney Animator Glen Keane and Producer Roy Conli presented a special Masterclass sharing their behind-the-scenes insights and love of the animation process.
Glen Keane has been with the Walt Disney Studios for over 25 years and is best known for his character animations for feature films such as ‘The Little Mermaid’, ‘Aladdin’, ‘Beauty and the Beast’, ‘Tarzan’, and ‘Tangled’. He reflects on the inspirations for some of his characters and expressing yourself through drawing.
Roy Conli is the producer of the Disney feature animated film, ‘Tangled’, based on the story of Rapunzel. He explains the role of the producer and the line between creating a safe and fertile environment for artists and getting a film made on time and within budget.

results.title: [Celebrating the Site's Flora and Fauna]
results.brief_description: Truganina Explosives Reserve in Altona is an environmental wonderland, containing rare flora and fauna. Much of the original landscape has remained untouched for over 100 years. This takes us back to a time when it was formally landscaped, and representative of the early Edwardian planting of the late 1880s. Please enjoy a serene journey through the reserve, celebrating this unique ecosystem.

results.title: Love serenade
results.creator_credit: Jan Chapman, Mandy Walker, Shirley Barrett, AFFC and Saddleback Productions
results.brief_description:
Two bored sisters, Dimity and Vicki-Ann, live in the small country town of Sunray. Their new neighbour, a brooding self-centered type, formerly star D.J. of a drive-time programme on Brisbane radio, threatens to turn the sisters’ world upside down. Dimity and Vicki-Ann find themselves in competition for his affections as each develops a severe crush on the aging Lothario with a predilection for 70’s music and young women. Awards: Cannes International Film Festival 1996: Camera d’Or for Shirley Barrett. Also available on VHS.

Credits: Producer, Jan Chapman ; director, writer, Shirley Barrett ; photography, Mandy Walker.
Cast: Miranda Otto, Rebecca Frith, George Shevtsov, John Alansu.

results.title: This is the army
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Hal B. Wallis, Jack L. Warner, Thirtieth Cemalux, Hollywood House Video and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In World War I dancer Jerry Jones stages an all-soldier show on Broadway, called Yip Yip Yaphank. Wounded in the War, he becomes a producer. In World War II his son Johnny Jones, previously his father’s assistant, gets the order to stage a new all-soldier show, called “This is the army”. But in his personal life he has problems, because he refuses to marry his fiance until the war is over. Cast includes George Murphy, Joan Leslie, George Tobias, Alan Hale, Kate Smith, and men from the armed forces including Ronald Reagan and Joe Louis. Based on the play by Irving Berlin, music and lyrics by Irving Berlin. Includes bonus blooper footage of Ronald Reagan in rehearsal. Note: “Copyright Thirtieth Cemalux Pty Ltd 1986”

results.title: Return home [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Cristina Pozzan, Mandy Walker, Ray Argall and Musical Films
results.brief_description: Noel, divorced and middle-aged, takes a break from his high pressure job in a big corporation to visit his brother, who, with his wife, is struggling to hang onto a barely viable small business - a service station in Adelaide. Gary, the 19 year old apprentice is struggling to come to terms with the complexities of life as an emerging adult and befriends Noel. Before long, Noel rediscovers the pleasures of family and is revitalised. After his return to Melbourne, his brother Gary and wife Judy, reassess their own lives and begin to see their own potential. Noel eventually returns to Adelaide for good; his journey for happiness, security and a future filled with promise is finally over. Ray Argall’s direction gives form and substance to everyday lives, with a sense of naturalism apparent. Stars Dennis Coard, Frankie J. Holden, Ben Mendelsohn and Micki Camilleri. Cinematography by Mandy Walker. Also available on VHS [305270].

results.title: Travelling light. Parklands [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Helen Bowden, Mandy Walker, Kathryn Millard, Soft Fruit, Showtime Australia, South Australian Film Corporation, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Travelling Light: Set in Adelaide in the 1970s comes writer/director Kathryn Millard’s debut feature film. Leanne Ferris (Pia Miranda) is supposed to be embracing her studies to become a teacher but is caught up in the social change and dynamism of the era when women and youth, in particular, were finding a new generation’s independence. The restrictive nature 1970s Australian society places on the married women in her life (Mum and elder sister Bronwyn) infuse Leanne with a drive to find her own path by becoming a photographer. Sexual forays, drug taking and poetry help shape Leanne’s young adulthood. Cast includes: Sacha Horler, Tim Draxl, Marshall Napier, Heather Mitchell, Simon Burke, Kestie Morassi, Tamblyn Lord. “Parklands” [307794]: Rosie (Cate Blanchett) is a young woman who returns to her home in Adelaide for her father’s (Tony Martin) funeral. This intriguing short film follows the path Rosie takes to solve the mystery of her father’s death. Talking with old friends, looking through diaries and photographs - reliving her childhood, she comes to understand the life of the man she called her father.

results.title: Japanese Story
results.creator_credit: Sue Maslin, Jill Bilcock, Alison Tilson, Sue Brooks, Film Victoria, ScreenWest, Showtime Australia, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Gecko Films
results.brief_description:
Australian geologist Sandy (Toni Collette) lands the unwanted task of showing a Japanese businessman Hiromitsu (Gotaro Tsunashima) around the mines and deserts of the Pilbara, hoping to sell his company the geology software she has been co-developing. Hiromitsu mistakes her for his driver and demands they go off-road, unaware of the dangers. The two journey further into the West Australian desert, gradually leaving what they know about each other and themselves behind.

Winner of 21 Australian film awards including 8 AFI Awards. Cast also includes Matthew Dyktynski, Lynette Curran, Yumiko Tanaka, John Howard.

results.title: Australian rules (A) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mark Lazarus, Mandy Walker, Paul Goldman, Tidy Town Pictures, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, South Australian Film Corporation, Adelaide Festival Corporation, Premium Movie Partnership and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Based on the award winning novel “Deadly, unna?” by Phillip Gwynne, “Australian rules” speculates on the deep rooted racism of a small rural fishing community, Prospect Bay, South Australia, where winning the premiership is the most exciting thing to happen since winning a tidy town competition. The film is viewed from the perspective of Blacky/Gary, a quiet, sensitive, and questioning youth who is best friends with football team mate Dumby Red, a brilliant aboriginal footballer and idealist, apparently unaffected by the animosity of older cousin Perry towards the whites. The status quo changes after a farcical grand final presentation in which one of the goonyas (whites) is selected over arguably Best on Ground Dumby. The football field proves the town’s racial arena whereby gunyas (blacks) are tolerated for their superior football prowess - off field, the small minded community is a pressure cooker of racism and hostilities which explode after a tragic event. Blacky’s relationship to Dumby’s sister Clarence also proves a point of contention with his abusive, belligerent and racist father. A thoughtful and passionate film, “Australian rules” was criticised in some sectors for being racist, it is however as much about friendship, intolerance, and life in an isolated community as it is about racism. Cast includes: Nathan Phillips, Luke Carroll, Lisa Flanagan, Tom Budge, Simon Westaway, Celia Ireland, Kevin Harrington. Screenplay by Phillip Gwynne with Paul Goldman.

results.title: Temptation of a monk = You seng [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Teddy Robin Kwan, Jill Bilcock, Clara Law and Tedpoly Films
results.brief_description: General Shi (Wu Hsin-kuo) is a loyal servant to heir apparent Prince Yuan-ji in the Chinese Tang Dynasty period. Fraternal jealousy is rampant amongst the sons in contention for the throne and Shi is offered the opportunity of a bloodless coup by a rival general: order his troops not to resist and no one will be hurt. The general reneges on his word and a bloody, trancelike battle ensues which sees the majority of Shi’s army, and the Prince, slaughtered. Shi, opposed to the new regime flees to a Buddhist shrine for refuge, and to secretly plot revenge with his comrades against those who turned against his leader. Another disastrous battle ensues in which he loses the Princess (Joan Chen) who has fallen in love with him and pursued him, as well as more men. Devastated he seeks redemption in a shrine, shaving heads of monks in the region, pondering his future, and being tempted by a widower (also played by Joan Chen) who visits the shrine seeking burial for her husband. Shot in an atmospheric blue hue, the plot of Clara Law’s film is at times hard to fathom, however it’s easy to savour the epic proportions of the film, the mesmerising battle scenes, and witness the restrained performance of the two leads as they manage to imbue their scenes with sensuality and passion. Cast also includes: Zhang Fengyui, Michael Lee.

results.title: Life
results.creator_credit: Elisa Argenzio, Mandy Walker, Lawrence Johnston, Rough Trade Pictures and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Johnston’s debut feature following on from his award winning shorts ‘Night Out’ and ‘Eternity’, is a dynamic re-visioning of actor/playwright John Brumpton’s theatre piece “Containment” that focused on the situation of inmates in the segregated HIV positive section of an Australian prison. To describe Johnston’s beautifully composed, movingly rendered, emotionally shattering film as ‘an AIDS prison drama’ denies it the full range and reach of its compelling grip on any number of wider issues and universal concerns. Brumpton forcefully fleshes out the lead role of quick-tempered hardened Des, a crim who tests positive and is sent to T2 division. His relationship with his cell-mate Ralph is vividly evoked via subliminal flashbacks and interaction between themselves and amongst the other inmates of T2. Photography, Mandy Walker. Cast: John Brumpton, David Tredinnick, Robert Morgan, Belinda McClory, Noel Jordan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elisa Argenzio, Mandy Walker, Lawrence Johnston, Rough Trade Pictures and Australian Film Commission
results.description: Johnston’s debut feature following on from his award winning shorts ‘Night Out’ and ‘Eternity’, is a dynamic re-visioning of actor/playwright John Brumpton’s theatre piece “Containment” that focused on the situation of inmates in the segregated HIV positive section of an Australian prison. To describe Johnston’s beautifully composed, movingly rendered, emotionally shattering film as ‘an AIDS prison drama’ denies it the full range and reach of its compelling grip on any number of wider issues and universal concerns. Brumpton forcefully fleshes out the lead role of quick-tempered hardened Des, a crim who tests positive and is sent to T2 division. His relationship with his cell-mate Ralph is vividly evoked via subliminal flashbacks and interaction between themselves and amongst the other inmates of T2. Photography, Mandy Walker. Cast: John Brumpton, David Tredinnick, Robert Morgan, Belinda McClory, Noel Jordan.
